clinical_study.brief_title: Low-dose CT-based Method for Detection of Subclinical Anthracycline-induced Cardiotoxicity
clinical_study.official_title: Low-dose CT-based Method for Detection of Subclinical Anthracycline-induced Cardiotoxicity

brief_summary.textblock: Prospective single arm study to evaluate a low-dose CT-based protocol for early detection of myocardial dysfunction in 50 cancer patients undergoing anthracycline-based chemotherapy.

primary_outcome.description: Cardiomyopathy is defined as a decrease in the left ventricular ejection fraction by echocardiography of greater than 10 percentage points, to a value < 53% (normal reference value for 2D echocardiography).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in CT-based left ventricular strain parameters
secondary_outcome.description: Change in CT-based left ventricular strain parameters before and after the chemotherapy

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in left ventricular global longitudinal strain based on echocardiography
secondary_outcome.description: Change in left ventricular global longitudinal strain between baseline and post-chemotherapy.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in echocardiographic left ventricular ejection fraction
secondary_outcome.description: left ventricular ejection fraction change between baseline and post-chemotherapy.

arm_group.description: 18-75 year old patients with newly-diagnosed cancer, scheduled to undergo anthracycline-based chemotherapy.

intervention.description: CT-based protocol for detection of anthracycline-induced myocardial dysfunction at early stages

facility.name: University of California San Diego Medical Center
